thread.title: Salzburg vs Man City U19s LIVE score and goal updates from UEFA Youth League game
thread.title_full: Salzburg vs Man City U19s LIVE score and goal updates from UEFA Youth League game

author: Simon Bajkowski
title: Salzburg vs Man City U19s LIVE score and goal updates from UEFA Youth League game
text:
Salzburg vs Man City U19s LIVE score and goal updates from UEFA Youth League game Updates from Manchester City's UEFA Youth League playoff against Austrian side Salzburg Share Share 
It's make or break time for Manchester City Under-19s in the UEFA Youth League. 
We are into the knockout rounds and this game will decide who goes through to the last-16 of the competition . 
City came second behind Barcelona in their group, while Salzburg have advanced by beating two national champions. 
Coach Simon Davies has challenged his players to show what they can do . 
"We're a lot better and further along the line than where we were maybe three years ago so we're doing the right things and the players are of the right quality and mentality. 
"But we need to go and prove to ourselves that we can do it in pressure situations." 
Kick-off is at 5pm and we'll be here throughout to see if City can come out on top in Austria. Key Events 16:13 Ongoing games 
There are two games that are currently in the second half. In those, Kobenvahn are tied 1-1 with Viitorul and Atletico lead Altinordu 1-0. 16:10 Play-off games 
The knockout rounds so far have nearly all gone in favour of the Champions League teams. 
Benfica beat Midtjylland 6-5 on penalties, Dortmund beat Maccabi Haifa 1-0 and Monaco came from behind to defeat Roma 2-1. 
Bucking the trend, Ajax defeated Moise Kean’s Juventus 2-0 yesterday. 16:07 KEY EVENT Other City news 
A reminder that if you’re wondering where the usual fill of all things Blue is not specific to an Under-19s match, you can find that right here! 16:06 Salzburg dangerman 
Nobody has scored more goals in the competition than Mergim Berisha. He has seven goals in two games, and has also racked up 11 goals in 19 appearances in the Austrian second tier. Will he get any change out of Humphreys and Adarabioyo though? (Photo: Dom Salter/MEN) 
Mergam Berisha is the name to look out for from this XI. 16:04 Substitutes 
And these are the players Davies can turn to as and when he needs them today. 
SUBS: Muric, Oliver, Latibeaudiere, Smith, Foden, Nemane, Buckley-Ricketts 16:02 
Here we go then. 
STARTING XI: Grimshaw, Duhaney, Humphreys, Adarabioyo, Francis, Diallo, Diaz, Kongolo, Nmecha, Fernandes, Sancho Lukas Nmecha, Demeaco Duhaney and Brahim Diaz celebrate Manchester City's fourth goal against Southampton in the FA Youth Cup (Photo: Joel Goodman/MEN) 15:54 Why the game is on 
Manchester City are once again competing in the UEFA Youth League, an Under-19s competition that mirrors the Champions League format. 
Running parallel with this since last season is a knockout format for national youth champions , reflecting the fact that some clubs may have better academies than first teams (and vice versa). 
Austrian side Salzburg have won two-legged ties against Macedonia’s FK Vardar and Kazakhstan’s FC Kairat, while City finished second in their group behind Barcelona; the two were then drawn together and one game will decide who progresses to the last-16. 15:48 Some of City's squad 
A few players picked out from their stroll earlier today that should be involved today: Aaron Nemane, Cameron Humphreys, Tosin Adarabioyo, Brahim Diaz, Paolo Fernandes, Lukas Nmecha, Charlie Oliver, Jadon Sancho, Phil Foden, Matt Smith, Joel Latibeaudiere 15:44 Taking a stroll 
The boys have been out and about in Austria getting used to the castle they will have to storm shortly. 15:43 Good afternoon 
Hello and welcome to our coverage of City’s UEFA Youth League play-off. Kick-off will be in just over an hour and team news should be with us shortly. Share
